newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Chinese try to block Hanson party.
newsitem.headline: Australian Chinese try to block Hanson party.

text.p: Chinese Australians in the northern state of Queensland asked authorities on Monday to block a new political party formed by local race row MP Pauline Hanson because it would violate anti-racism laws.

The Queensland Chinese Community Voice, representing about 30,000 Chinese Australians lodged an objection to the party's registration with the Australian Electoral Commission, the community's legal advisor Lawrence Ma said.

Hanson, who created an international storm last year with her attacks on Asian immigration and Aboriginal welfare, announced last month she was forming her own "One Nation" party and aimed to become a major force in politics.
Ma said his association had lodged an objection to Hanson's party on the grounds its existence contravened Australian laws against racial discrimination and racial hatred.
"Racism will not die in Australia unless we fight it," Ma told Reuters.
"Our legal advice is that if the commission's decision is unfavourable to us, then we could take our objections to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal," he added.
Ma said blocking registration of Hanson's party "would stop most of the problems, but of course they could register the party under another name elsewhere".
